Hi, and welcome to my website!

I am a Ph.D. student in the Department of Statistics & Data Science at Carnegie Mellon University. I graduated magna cum laude from Pomona College with a double major in Mathematics and Philosophy in Spring 2024.

Currently, I am working with [Nynke Niezink](https://www.stat.cmu.edu/~nynke/) and [Eva Jaspers](https://www.uu.nl/staff/EJaspers) on a continuation of my Advanced Data Analysis project, titled "Why Do Students Avoid Each Other? Investigating Positive and Negative Network Effects." I am also working on a project with [Erin Franke](https://efranke22.github.io) and [Alex Reinhart](https://www.refsmmat.com) in which we analyze statistics studentsâ€™ writing before and after the emergence of Large Language Models. I have previously been involved in statistical genomics and data science ethics pedagogy research with [Jo Hardin](https://hardin47.netlify.app). 

Find out more about my interests and past experiences by browsing this site.
